greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number triangle associated to Chebyshev polynomials of first kind.
link: Index entries for sequences related to Chebyshev polynomials.
formula: Number triangle S(n, k)=T(n-k, k), k<n, S(n, n)=1, 0 otherwise, where T(n, k)=(n/2)sum{j=0..floor(n/2), C(n-j, j)(-1)^j*(2k)^(n-2j)}.
Also, square array if(n=0, 1, T(n, k)) read by antidiagonals.
example: As a number triangle, rows begin:
As a square array, rows begin
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := SeriesCoefficient[x^k (1 - k x)/(1 - 2 k x + x^2), {x, 0, n}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 11}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 12 2017 *)
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Dec 02 2004
